<figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img src="http://40.media.tumblr.com/d20fbf85ecd92526c094206d1e52bcfa/tumblr_inline_nveq4u3Bid1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"/></figure><figure class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full" data-provider="youtube" data-orig-width="540" data-orig-height="304" data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DeF_w4ldMp8w"><iframe width="540" height="304" id="youtube_iframe" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eF_w4ldMp8w?feature=oembed&enablejsapi=1&origin=https://safe.txmblr.com&wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></figure><p>

Mike Aben is a teacher interested in astronomy, math, video games, sci fi, tech and other fun stuff. You could visit and subscribe his YouTube Channel and have fun!<br/>In this episode Jeb and Glephia get a lifeboat and Mike launches his first interplanetary probe on its way to Duna. <a href="https://www.facebook.com/hashtag/ksp?source=feed_text&story_id=1057170424302181">Ã¢â‚¬Âª#Ã¢â‚¬Å½KSPÃ¢â‚¬Â¬</a><br/></p>
Nice to see Mike's work getting some extra attention; I've been following this let's-play since Ep 1 and it's been fascinating.

I rather like this guy's style He seems to be into optimising his missions and doing them 'properly' rather than getting to places and discovering that his craft doesn't work because <avoidable reasons>. Probably a great series to find if you're just getting into KSP first time and want some guidance ^^
